In languages with relatively fixed word order, grammatical role assignment can usually be inferred based on word order alone, ren- dering case marking redundant.
In flexible-word-order languages, however, case provides important information about sentence meaning, as word order is less informative of grammatical role assignment.

The trade-off between cues to grammatical role assignment has been argued to stem from a trade-off between robust message transmission – the speaker’s goal to be understood – and production effort (Fedzechkina, Jaeger, & Newport, 2012, 2016; Kurumada & Jaeger, 2015).
